comment: This is a page from a classical Chinese dictionary or lexicographical text, likely the *Shuowen Jiezi* (说文解字) or a similar work. The layout includes large characters in seal script (篆书) on the left, with corresponding explanations and phonetic annotations in regular script (楷书) to their right. The heading '文三' indicates this is the third entry in a section. The main character being explained is '虎' (tiger), with various forms and derivatives listed, including ancient scripts and variant forms. The text provides etymological, phonetic, and semantic information typical of such classical texts.
